page.title: 03Housing in Cowlinge
page.content: There is a wide variety of dwellings in the village. Several farm-houses have moats and are believed to be 16th century. There are a lot of lath and plaster cottages with thatched roofs, flint cottages, red bricked houses, council houses and bungalows. Several buildings are listed grade 2 or 3 under the Ancient Monuments Act. The primary school, Mill House, Bake House, several public houses and achapel have all been converted into private homes. Very little new building is allowed (and then only in the main street) and application to the County Council has to be made before any alterations or enlargements to existing buildings can be made.
